prompt:
You are provided with a list of characters, evidences and testimonies.
Characters:
Character 0
Name: Maya Fey
Description: My assistant and a disciple in the Kurain Tradition of spirit channeling.
Character 1
Name: Mia Fey
Description: Maya's older sister and my eternal mentor in life and law. Passed away 2 years ago.
Character 2
Name: Godot
Description: A prosecutor who is shrouded in mystery. He seems to know me somehow.
Character 3
Name: Dick Gumshoe
Description: Homicide detective at the local precinct. In charge of the initial investigation.
Character 4
Name: Maggey Byrde
Description: A waitress at Tres Bien. Was found guilty of murder thanks to the phony me.
Character 5
Name: Jean Armstrong
Description: Tres Bien's owner and chef. A witness in the case who is also into aromatherapy.
Character 6
Name: Glen Elg
Description: The victim. Was a programmer. Maggey had apparently never even seen him before.
Character 7
Name: Victor Kudo
Description: Was in Tres Bien at the time of the incident. Has a thing for waitresses.
Character 8
Name: Lisa Basil
Description: The CEO of Blue Screens, Inc., and Glen Elg's boss. Absolutely not a robot.
Character 9
Name: Violetta → Viola Cadaverini
Description: Possibly part of the staff at Tender Lender? A thoroughly bitter person.
Character 10
Name: Furio Tigre
Description: The head of Tender Lender loan company. Also known as "The Tiger".
Character 11
Name: Bruto Cadaverini
Description: The head of the Cadaverini Family crime syndicate. Seems to live for his granddaughter.
Evidences:
Evidence 0
Name: Attorney's Badge
Description: It's my all-important badge. It shows that I am a defense attorney.
Evidence 1
Name: Maya's Magatama
Description: A present from Maya. It reacts to people who have secrets in their hearts. On loan from Maya. Recovered in the kitchen of Tres Bien.
Evidence 2
Name: Magazine Clipping
Description: An article from December 5th. Says I was trounced and my client was found guilty.
Evidence 3
Name: Sports Paper
Description: Dates from December 3rd, the day of the incident. On it is a doodle that said 'MC Bomber' with an arrow pointing to '100,000' that was crossed out. 'Ahahahaha' and a laughing face are written next to it. Left by a costumer in Tres Bien on Dec. 3rd. Left by the victim. Doodle is in victim's handwriting.
Evidence 4
Name: Job Listings
Description: Picked up from a bench in Vitamin Square. Thrown away by the old man.
Evidence 5
Name: Lunch Special
Description: Tres Bien lunch special. Costs 20 dollars despite how unbelievably bad it tastes.
Evidence 6
Name: Small Bottle
Description: Found in the kitchen. Shape is different from the others bottles. Contents unknown. The victim's ear medicine. Found covered in unidentified fingerprints in the kitchen. The victim's ear medicine. Covered in Furio Tigre's fingerprints.
Evidence 7
Name: Scooter
Description: Ridden by my phony. The wheel guard is all smashed up.
Evidence 8
Name: Jean's Loan Contract
Description: Jean's debt is half a million dollars. The owner of the loan is Tender Lender.
Evidence 9
Name: Victor's Note
Description: "Convicted before, a wicked man or woman, repeat offender -- Victor Kudo"
Evidence 10
Name: Glen's Autopsy Report
Description: Died of potassium cyanide poisoning. Time of death was between 1:30 and 2:30 PM.
Evidence 11
Name: Tres Bien Floor Plans
Description: Blueprints of the crime scene. [caption] The view from the entrance is obstructed and could only see the patio.
Evidence 12
Name: Crime Photo
Description: A photo of the scene taken from near the kitchen. [caption] Two dining tables are separated by a folding screen. The one closer to the camera is empty. The other one is where the victim collapse on the table. There is an intact vase on each table. A coffee cup is knocked over and the the table cloth is stained by coffee. Near the coffee table are some pieces of papers. No one is sitting across from the victim.
Evidence 13
Name: Coffee Cup
Description: The coffee contained potassium cyanide. Covered in the victim and Maggey's fingerprints.
Evidence 14
Name: Victim's Lottery Ticket
Description: A winning ticket for half a million dollars. Found during a body search of Maggey.
Evidence 15
Name: Apron
Description: Worn by Maggey at the time of the incident. Has small pockets but big stains.
Evidence 16
Name: Potassium Cyanide
Description: A deadly powdery poison. Bears Maggey's fingerprints. Found in her apron pocket.
Evidence 17
Name: Victim's Prescription Bag
Description: The victim got this from the doctor before going to Tres Bien. The bag is empty.
Evidence 18
Name: Victor's Testimony
Description: "When the incident occurred, I broke the vase at my seat. I'm sorry."
Evidence 19
Name: Millionaire Radio Flyer
Description: Experience the most thrilling ten minutes of your life every Monday at 1:30 PM!
Evidence 20
Name: Glen's Calendar
Description: On Dec. 3rd, the day of the incident, there is a note saying, "Meet with The Tiger".
Evidence 21
Name: Losing Horse Racing Tickets
Description: Horse racing betting tickets. Found in Glen Elg's desk. There's over 500 of them!
Evidence 22
Name: Gumshoe's Lunchbox
Description: A tenderly handmade lunchbox. Fills the stomach with love and plenty of weenies.
Evidence 23
Name: MC Bomber
Description: Found at Tender Lender. A sample disc with the name written in marker. Found at Tender Lender. Contains a computer virus program. A computer virus made by Glen Elg. Potentially worth million of dollars.
Evidence 24
Name: Tres Bien Matches
Description: Matches used for advertising. Found lying in Tender Lender.
Evidence 25
Name: Repair Bill
Description: A car repair bill for $15,000. Paid by Tigre to the Cadaverini Family.
Evidence 26
Name: Paper Badge
Description: Found at Tender Lender. Made of cardboard and painted to look authentic.
Evidence 27
Name: Viola's Medical Papers
Description: A 1 million dollar bill for cranial surgery. Payment was due last year.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: La mirror, it was in z'e middle of la restaurant, dividing z'e two 'alves.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 1
Testimony: Z'ere is only one seat from which you could 'ave seen an image of la victim.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 2
Testimony: Z'at was la seat at z'e table next to la victim's. Z'at was where la old man was sitting.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 3
Testimony: After la terrible incident occurred, I move la mirror so it was not in z'e way.
Person: Armstrong
Testimony 4
Testimony: But naturally, I did not touch anything else!
Person: Armstrong

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
To find a contradiction between the evidence and testimony, let's analyze Armstrong's testimonies and the available evidence:

- **Testimony 3**: "After la terrible incident occurred, I move la mirror so it was not in z'e way."

Armstrong claims that he only moved the mirror after the incident. However, we can verify this against the floor layout and crime scene evidence.

Upon examining the **Crime Photo** (Evidence 12), it provides a description that mentions the position of the dining tables and folding screen (referred to as a mirror in earlier testimonies), along with other elements that hint whether or not any displacement occurred before or after the incident. The evidence suggests the absence of broken vases from near the folding screen, which contradicts Armstrong's claim that he only moved the mirror afterwards as changes were already made to the scene.

Therefore, Armstrong's testimony contradicts the crime photo evidence that shows elements displaced before the reported incident actions.

{"evidence": 12, "testimony": 3}

response:
To identify a contradiction, we need to find evidence that conflicts with a given testimony. 

Let's examine Jean Armstrong's testimony 3 which claims: "Z'ere were no other customers." 

Evidence 18 contains Victor's Testimony: "When the incident occurred, I broke the vase at my seat. I'm sorry." This implies that Victor Kudo was indeed a customer in the restaurant when the incident took place, contradicting Armstrong's statement that there were no other customers.

Thus, the contradiction exists between Armstrong's testimony 3 and evidence 18.

{"evidence": 18, "testimony": 3}

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
The evidence that contradicts the testimony revolves around the claim made by Tigre about having "whales lined up to borrow cash from Tender Lender every single day." This suggests a successful loan business. However, Jean's Loan Contract (Evidence 8) indicates that Jean Armstrong owed a significant debt to Tender Lender and was struggling to repay it. If Tender Lender had so many profitable clients, they might not have relied on extracting such loans from struggling individuals like Jean Armstrong, suggesting that Tigre's claim of constant successful business may not be entirely true.

{"evidence": 8, "testimony": 3}

response:
Testimony 4 by Tigre states, "I ain't never been to that Tres Bien joint, youse hear?" However, Evidence 8, "Jean's Loan Contract," shows that Tigre is the owner of Tender Lender, the loan company to which Jean Armstrong owes half a million dollars. Given that Jean is the owner and chef of Tres Bien, it implies Tigre would have been involved in dealings related to Tres Bien, contradicting his claim of never having been there.

Testimonies:
Testimony 0
Testimony: I was supposed to meet wid the kid at the restaurant that afternoon.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 1
Testimony: When I opened the door to the joint, I saw one ugly scene.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 2
Testimony: The guy was laid out over the table, stiff as concrete.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 3
Testimony: I figured if the place wasn't hot already, it was gonna be, so I split.
Person: Tigre
Testimony 4
Testimony: I heard the cop's sirens on my way out, and I went straight back to my office.
Person: Tigre

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
Furio Tigre's testimony suggests that he left the crime scene swiftly to avoid getting caught up in the investigation. In his third testimony, he mentions, "I figured if the place wasn't hot already, it was gonna be, so I split." However, Evidence 14, the Victim's Lottery Ticket, was found on Maggey Byrde during a body search. This suggests that Furio Tigre might have framed Maggey by placing this evidence on her, contradicting his statement that he simply left the scene without any further involvement. This discrepancy suggests Tigre didn't just leave; he had enough time to plant evidence.

{"evidence": 14, "testimony": 3}

Testimony 1

Testimony 2

Which evidence and testimony contradict each other? You must only answer one pair. You may output an explanation, but your answer must end with a JSON format like so: {"evidence": 2, "testimony": 3}. The answer JSON should strictly be the last line, followed by nothing else.
response:
To find the contradiction, we need to analyze the evidence and testimonies related to the case, focusing on the motivation and situation described by Furio Tigre in his testimonies. 

Furio Tigre, in Testimony 3, claims: "I'm about to flatten the guy, when he starts screamin'." This implies that Glen Elg had no means of paying back and was in a desperate situation until he somehow screamed about winning money.

Testimony 4 elaborates on this further with Glen exclaiming: "Yesss! I won! Half a million bucks!" indicating he supposedly had won a lot of money suddenly.

Meanwhile, the Victim's Lottery Ticket (Evidence 14) is worth half a million dollars and was found on Maggey Byrde, suggesting that Glen Elg really did have a winning ticket, strengthening the argument that he screamed about having the funds.

However, Tigre contradicts his motive with Testimony 7, which says: "I was after the $100,000. I didn't have no other reason to kill the guy!" This testimony implies that there was no reason for Tigre to attack Glen if Glen could pay him back.

To find the contradiction, consider Evidence 23, which shows that Glen Elg created a highly valuable computer virus program, dubbed MC Bomber, valued at potentially more than just the $100,000 dollar debt. This provides a significant motive for Tigre to kill him despite Glen supposedly having the winning lottery ticket, as obtaining the virus program through illegal means would be more lucrative.

The contradiction exists because Tigre claims his only motive was the $100,000 payback, while multiple pieces of evidence (particularly Evidence 23) suggest there was a potentially far more valuable item involved (MC Bomber), which isn’t addressed by his testimonies.

So, the evidence contradicting Tigre's testimony that he didn't have another reason would be Evidence 23.
